conditionalExpression.Html:
{{userInfoFormGroup.controls.dataType.errors.numeric.message}}
If you want to apply conditional validation on 'Real Number' then you need to add 'Data Type' input as 'Real'.
 Conditional Expression with type 'string'
 {{userInfoFormGroup.controls.realNumber.errors.numeric.message}}
If you want to apply conditional validation on 'Integer Number' then you need to add 'Data Type' input as 'Positive'.
 Conditional Expression with type 'function'
 {{userInfoFormGroup.controls.integerNumber.errors.numeric.message}}

Notes: Binding conditionalExpression with string object.
Binding conditionalExpression with Function object.

dynamic.Json: {"dataType":{"numeric":true},"negativeNumber":{"acceptValue":"NumericValueType.NegativeNumber","message":"'{{0}} is not a negative number'"},"decimalNumber":{"allowDecimal":"true","message":"'{{0}} is not a decimal number'"},"realNumber":{"acceptValue":"NumericValueType.Both","conditionalExpression":"'x => x.dataType == \"Real\"'"}}
